statement.tex: \text{Find the integral of the function}\\ \dfrac{\cos 2 x}{(\cos x+\sin x)^2} \,

step.context: \text{Are the following calculations and analysis correct?}
\text{Is the following evaluation of the integral}\\ \int \dfrac{\cos 2x}{1 + \sin 2x} \, dx \quad \text{correct}?
step.tex:
\text{Let } 1 + \sin 2 x = t \implies 2 \cos 2x \, dx = dt \\
\begin{align}
\int \dfrac{\cos 2x}{1 + \sin 2x} \, dx &= \dfrac{1}{2} \int \dfrac{1}{t} dt \\ &= \dfrac{1}{2} \log |1 + \sin 2x| + C \\ &= \dfrac{1}{2} \log |(\sin x + \cos x)^2| + C \end{align} \\
\therefore \int \dfrac{\cos 2 x}{(\cos x+\sin x)^2} \, dx = \log| \cos x+\sin x|+C

\text{Let } 1 + \sin 2 x = t \implies 2 \cos 2x \, dx = dt \\
\begin{align}
\int \dfrac{\cos 2x}{1 + \sin 2x} \, dx &= \dfrac{1}{2} \int \dfrac{1}{t} dt \\ &= \dfrac{1}{2} \log |(1 + \sin 2x)^2| + C \\ &= \dfrac{1}{2} \log |(\sin x + \cos x)^4| + C \end{align} \\
\therefore \int \dfrac{\cos 2 x}{(\cos x+\sin x)^4} \, dx = 2 \log| \cos x+\sin x|+C
